Html: In the latest (v2 Feb 2009) drop, the assembly references for System.Windows.Controls.Data are looking for them in the GAC (which since its a SL assemblies isn't there). Is this by design or an oversight.  Easy to fix but frustrating.

Hi,

When you open Visual Studio, isn’t it finding the assembly? Do you have to create a new reference to the assembly manually?

The System.Windows.Controls.Data assembly, among others, is installed when you run the Microsoft Silverlight Tools for Visual Studio 2008 SP1 installer generally in the path: %Program Files%\Microsoft SDKs\Silverlight\v2.0\Libraries\Client. So, if you install it before opening your solution, Visual Studio should be able to find the assembly.

 

Please, let me know if this helps.
